Description: Broad shallow handmade dish in Nile silt with a simple rim, flaring walls and flattened base. The interior has traces of a polished red slip and red painted linear patterns, while the exterior is mottled with firing stains. Restored from fragments.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: F. Ll. Griffith, 'Liverpool Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology 8 (Liverpool, 1921), 13.
